creator: zander@objectstorm.net

text:
This seems to be an unrelated problem with the XML parser you have (maybe as a 
system extension or something). Jasper requires a JAXP 1.1 compliant parser.
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
Well, aparently IBM has IBM parser in their JDK implementation or something 
like that. Regardless installing Tomcat 4.0.3 on a clean box with 

java version "1.3.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.3.0)
Classic VM (build 1.3.0, J2RE 1.3.0 IBM build cn130-20010609 (JIT enabled: jitc)
)

result in an exception. Switching VM to Sun VM by adding
set JAVA_HOME=e:\java\jdk1.3.1
to startup.bat fixes the problem. However IBM VM is way faster then Suns.
creator: zander@objectstorm.net

text:
If the parser included in the VM (either bundled or set as a system extension)
is not JAXP 1.1 compliant, then it will not work.
Tomcat won't run, and we will not fix it (fix the VM instead; either find a way
to override the included parser, or remove the parser you have in your extensions).
creator: remm@apache.org
Andreas.Junghans@fh-karlsruhe.de
text:
I'm successfully using IBM JDK and Tomcat 4.0.3 on Windows NT 4.0 (no problems 
at all, no changes made to the jars included). "java -version" says:

java version "1.3.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.3.0)
Classic VM (build 1.3.0, J2RE 1.3.0 IBM build cn130-20010925 (JIT enabled: jitc)
)

Are you sure you don't have old jars hanging around somewhere?

IBM build cn130-20010925 indeed works. I guess I would have to upgrade to newer 
version.
creator: zander@objectstorm.net
